item.title:
It's not just hedge funds that rip off customers.
It's also banks. Case Europe, where savers are getting screwed, whereas banks reap the profits.
No wonder why German savers stay poor.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: After all, blockchain innovation is disintermediating middlemen; replacing manual organisations with automated ones.
AI does not order the most expensive wine in a restaurant.
With DeFi, smart contracts, streamlined operations, we lower the threshold for users to get exposure.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
After all, blockchain innovation is disintermediating middlemen; replacing manual organisations with automated ones.

AI does not order the most expensive wine in a restaurant.

With DeFi, smart contracts, streamlined operations, we lower the threshold for users to get exposure.

item.title:
Hedge funds can, on average, beat the market.
However, most of the value created gets lost in the management fees.
With smart contracts and DeFi, we can have leaner management with fewer fees.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
Hedge funds can, on average, beat the market.

However, most of the value created gets lost in the management fees.

With smart contracts and DeFi, we can have leaner management with fewer fees.

item.title:
RT by @TradingProtocol: 8/ Domain Expertise & Data (On-Chain & Off-Chain)
At the end of the day, it comes down to data and domain expertise. More data means means better results. More domain specific data, means better domain specific results. This is where projects like @TradingProtocol are different from the current approach to AI Agents in DeFi. Instead of the simplistic approach of prompting a LLM — with TradingProtocol you can leverage existing quantitative models to execute automated trades. The best part is that the data on which these models are trained on is open source, allowing you to create your own quantitative models.
One could imagine that a better solution to the DeFAI / AiFi meta would be to have a conversational agent leverage an existing trading strategy … or survey the response of an existing quantitative models… to provide better feedback to the user on a particular asset.
item.dc:creator: @irvinxyz
item.description:
8/ Domain Expertise & Data (On-Chain & Off-Chain)

At the end of the day, it comes down to data and domain expertise. More data means means better results. More domain specific data, means better domain specific results. This is where projects like @TradingProtocol are different from the current approach to AI Agents in DeFi. Instead of the simplistic approach of prompting a LLM — with TradingProtocol you can leverage existing quantitative models to execute automated trades. The best part is that the data on which these models are trained on is open source, allowing you to create your own quantitative models.

One could imagine that a better solution to the DeFAI / AiFi meta would be to have a conversational agent leverage an existing trading strategy … or survey the response of an existing quantitative models… to provide better feedback to the user on a particular asset.

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 16/ WHY TRADING STRATEGY?
Trading Strategy's Base datasets enable quant developers to create, backtest, and optimise their algorithmic trading strategies with familiar tooling:
- First-class Python and data research support
- Local development, bring-your-own-tools model
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
16/ WHY TRADING STRATEGY?

Trading Strategy's Base datasets enable quant developers to create, backtest, and optimise their algorithmic trading strategies with familiar tooling:

- First-class Python and data research support

- Local development, bring-your-own-tools model

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 15/ - Uniswap CLMM data for LP and market-making strategies
- Token quality data (risk score, labelling)
- Cross-referencing with CoinGecko and TokenSniffer

item.description:

- Cross-referencing with CoinGecko and TokenSniffer

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 10/ Base is best what EVM technology can offer today
- Gas efficient: low transaction cost
- Immune to MEV, frontrunning and other public mempool-based malicious activities
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 9/ Base comes with hiqh quality assetes and protocols
- Native USDC support
- Native Coinbase Wrapped Bitcoin (cbBTC) support
- Home for well-established DeFi protocols like Uniswap, Aerodrome, Aave Fast: low transaction latency

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 7/ WHY BASE
Base is very good chain for traders. Some benefits of Base L2 include:
- Vast variety of different assets to trade (we list 56,000 active trading pairs out of 1 million)
- Good volumes
